definition: (of a smell) strong/peak season (of a crop)/(classifier for the ordinal number of a crop, in the context of multiple harvests)
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes

sentences.english: This site was flanked by a pair of lotus ponds, _and_to the north was a round fountain.
sentences.chinese: 五竹亭北设有圆形喷水池，左右为荷花池。

sentences.english: In the middle of the forest there was a fountain.
sentences.chinese: 森林中央有一座喷水池。

sentences.english: With high water absorption of stone, can be used for landscape fountain and other functions.
sentences.chinese: 具有高吸水性的石材，可以用于景观喷水池等功能。

sentences.english: The parks of this city are famous for their spectacular fountains.
sentences.chinese: 这个城市的公园以他们壮观喷水池而著名。

sentences.english: She sat down on the side of the cool fountain.
sentences.chinese: 她坐在清凉的喷水池旁边。

sentences.english: A worker cleaned the bronze engravings on the north fountain before the ceremonies began.
sentences.chinese: 仪式开始前，工作人员擦拭北喷水池上的刻字。

sentences.english: On a visit to Rome, she takes some coins from a fountain.
sentences.chinese: 她在造访罗马时，从喷水池里拿了几个硬币。

sentences.english: They passed by the fountain and entered the hall.
sentences.chinese: 我们走过喷水池进入大厅。

sentences.english: The fountain is a white elephant.
Then, one day, they meet in front of the fountain in the park.
sentences.chinese: 于是，有一天，他们在公园里的喷水池前相遇了。

sentences.english: Performance may be improved by use of a spray pond .
sentences.chinese: 使用喷水池可以改善其性能。

definition: Huatan township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
decorative mass planting of flowers and shrubs, often bounded by a low masonry border, and often part of a streetscape
promenade/long hallway/Long Corridor in the Summer Palace, Beijing 北京頤和園|北京颐和园[Bei3 jing1 Yi2 he2 yuan2]
